III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section Program statement
Description (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
1

(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation It was reported that staff member gave a youth drugs. It was also
reported that another youth gave the youth drugs rather than staff.
This youth and another youth tested positive for marijuana.
Investigation Emails were exchanged with Complainant on June 24, 2025,
and no further information was reported.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
25, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
this information was the same information DHHS Worker and I
talked to her about for investigation 2025SIC0000553. Youth A
denied having any new information to report about seeing drugs or
vapes at the facility. Youth A stated the information she told the
court was the same information DHHS Worker and I interviewed
her about in the past (2025SIC0000553).
Director of Residential was interviewed face to face at the
facility on June 25, 2025, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director of Residential denied being aware of any incidents or
allegations since the previous investigation (2025SIC0000553) of
staff or another youth providing Youth A with marijuana.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on June
25, 2025. Youth B denied seeing any drugs or vapes at the
facility. Youth B reported she has never been offered drugs or
vapes by any staff member or youth at the facility.
Documents Reviewed:
• Special Investigation Report 2025SIC0000553 dated
05/27/2025. There was no rule violation regarding staff
providing marijuana to youths but there was a rule violation
for a staff member not locking her purse, containing a
nicotine vape pen in her vehicle, and a youth taking the
vape pen from the staff’s purse and the staff not telling the
administration.
• Eagle Village Staff Code of Conduct Policy. Policy states,
“Staff are prohibited from providing cigarette lighters,
cigarettes, vape pens, chewing tobacco, or any other
item/substance that is illegal for a minor to use or have in
their possession. If a staff uses any of these items
personally and they are brought to campus, staff shall keep
2

these belongings secure in a place such as locked in their
vehicles. Smoking and vaping are not allowed on our
campus.”
Analysis The facility was found in noncompliance during the prior
investigation, 2025SIC0000553 dated 05/27/2025 for an additional
finding of staff not completing an incident report or telling
administration a youth stole a nicotine vape pen from the staff’s
purse due to the staff not locking the nicotine vape pen in the
staff’s vehicle. There were no findings regarding any staff
providing marijuana to youth in investigation 2025SIC0000553 or
in this investigation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
